question: India signed an Agreement for Cooperation with which of the following country?
explanation: The India-Japan Agreement for Cooperation in the Peaceful Uses of Nuclear Energy was signed in Tokyo during the visit of Prime Minister Narendra Modi to Japan. It would enable Japan to export nuclear power plant technology as well as provide finance for nuclear power plants in India. India signed the civil nuclear deal with 10 other countries namely Russia, United States, France, South Korea, Mongolia, Namibia, Argentina, Canada, Kazakhstan and Australia.
